Norway Northern Lights

Come and see the Green Lights of the North

22nd – 29th October 2026

What's to get excited about!

There are many ancient myths that surround the Aurora Boralis or the ‘Norhtern Lights’ as we commonly refer to them. Some say that the display are dragons fighting in the sky, other say that if you give birth under the beautiful night displays then child birth can be pain free and in Greenland, the mystics believed that the mysterious green lights are a ball game between people using a walrus skull as a ball. The Northern Lights can inspire us in so many ways and we invite you to form your own interpretation by joining us in Tromso, Norway.

We will be staying in a cosy, seven bedroom house just south of Tromso on a fjord known as Ramfjord. Just thirty minutes from the island of Tromso, nestled on the shores, we can enjoy the island known as the ‘Capital of the Northern lights’. By day it is a refuge of tranquillity packed with wildlife where we’ll be looking out for white tailed eagle, porpoise, orcas and sea otter. But of course, it’s the evening where true wonder occurs and from our house we will have the perfect vantage point to watch the skies for those magical lights.

Our itinerary will include a visit to the original Norwegians, The Sami people, where we will learn about their culture, help to feed their flocks of reindeer and sit alongside them in their huts whilst eating a Sami traditional lunch around a cosy fire. We will also be taking a trip from Tromso on a small boat, down the fjord with our friends at Polar Adventures. On board, we will experience the stark beauty of the fjord from the water. There’s a five-hour trip to enjoy, not least of all because it includes lunch with fresh fish …… caught by us!

We’re delighted to announce that we will again be meeting back up with another friend of ours made over the years, Daniel from Flexitours. Daniel will give us a guided tour of Kvaloya, a neighbouring island of Tromso and will show us all the key parts of Kvaloya (which means Whale Island), including stunning deserted sandy beaches and will be preparing for us a wholesome lunch.

Tromso itself is a wonderful place and we will take the time to stroll around this cosy town, visiting it’s cafes, shops and churches, all of which are surrounded by snow-covered Norwegian mountains. We will also be taking guided tours of the Arctic Polaria and Perspektif Museums.

Why not come and join us on a trip that will stay with you for an eternity!

Where you'll be staying...

Eimes Farm is a large house that has been recently renovated on the scenic Malang Peninsula, 35 minutes from Tromso airport. It has lovely views of the fjords and mountains. The perfect place to see the Northern Lights. The house has two modern bathrooms and seven bedrooms.

Food, glorious food!

All of our food will be lovingly prepared and cooked by our wonderful chef, Helen.

What you'll experience...

We will meet at a London airport and you will be supported on the flight to Tromso Airport in Norway. Our mini-buses will take you on the 35-minute drive to the accommodation.

Ininerary

Day 1 – Travel from London to Tromso, travel to our accommodation via mini bus, settle in.

Day 2 – Visit the Sami People camp

Day 3 –Visit the Perspectif museum and Tromso town.

Day 4 – Guided tour exploring the island of Kvaloya

Day 5 – Rest Day.

Day 6 – Wildlife boat trip down the fjord.

Day 7 – Visit the Arctic Polaria Museum for a guided tour.

Day 8 – Drive back to Tromso Airport for flight back to London.

Your holiday will include the following:

  • 7-night, full board accommodation.
  • All entrance fees to all activities and sites.
  • Airport transfers and transport in and around Norway.
  • • Return flight from London to Norway, accompanied and supported by our Go Beyond team.
  • A ratio of 2 guests to 1 Go Beyond support staff member.
  • Support from our Go Beyond team during the holiday.
